alert.note: Alert for Greene; Morgan; Oconee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Oconee, southeastern Morgan and northwestern Greene Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Apalachee, or near Madison, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Madison, Buckhead, Carey, Swords, Wrayswood, Greshamville and Apalachee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
